MathNet.Numerics.Interpolation.Algorithms.ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation Class Reference

Barycentric Polynomial Interpolation where the given sample points are chebyshev nodes of the first kind. More...

Detailed Description

Barycentric Polynomial Interpolation where the given sample points are chebyshev nodes of the first kind.

This algorithm neither supports differentiation nor integration.

Definition at line 188 of file ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation.cs.

static double [] MathNet.Numerics.Interpolation.Algorithms.ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation.GenerateSamplePoints ( double  a,
double  b,
int  numberOfPoints 
) [static]

Generate a set of chebyshev points of the first kind in the interval [a,b]. These are the expected points t for the values v(t) to be provided in Init.

Parameters:
a Left bound of the interval.
b Right bound of the interval.
numberOfPoints Number of sample nodes to generate.
Returns:
Chebyshev points (first kind) in the interval [a,b], i.e. 0.5*(b+a) + 0.5*(b-a)*cos(Pi*(2*i+1)/(2*n))

Definition at line 222 of file ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation.cs.

static double [] MathNet.Numerics.Interpolation.Algorithms.ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation.GenerateSamplePoints ( double  a,
double  b,
int  numberOfPoints 
) [static]

Generate a set of chebyshev points of the first kind in the interval [a,b]. These are the expected points t for the values v(t) to be provided in Init.

Parameters:
a Left bound of the interval.
b Right bound of the interval.
numberOfPoints Number of sample nodes to generate.
Returns:
Chebyshev points (first kind) in the interval [a,b], i.e. 0.5*(b+a) + 0.5*(b-a)*cos(Pi*(2*i+1)/(2*n))

Definition at line 222 of file ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation.cs.

void MathNet.Numerics.Interpolation.Algorithms.ChebyshevFirstKindPolynomialInterpolation.Init ( double  a,
double  b,
IList< double >  x 
)

Initialize the interpolation method with the given samples on chebyshev nodes of the first kind in the interval [a,b].

Parameters:
a Left bound of the sample point interval.
b Right bound of the sample point interval.
x Values x(t) where t are chebyshev nodes over [a,b], i.e. x[i] = x(0.5*(b+a) + 0.5*(b-a)*cos(Pi*(2*i+1)/(2*n)))

x Values x(t) where t are chebyshev nodes over [a,b], i.e. x[i] = x(0.5*(b+a) + 0.5*(b-a)*cos(Pi*(2*i+1)/(2*n)))
